author: Michael S. Derby
title: Fed’s Mester: Gradual Rate Rises Needed to Keep Recovery on Track
text:
Federal Reserve Bank of Cleveland President Loretta Mester said Thursday steady interest-rate rises are needed to keep the economy humming along, in remarks that cautioned against deliberating overheating the economy in a bid to help boost employment.
“A gradual upward path of interest rates will help sustain the expansion and balance the risks so that our monetary policy goals are met and maintained,” Ms. Mester said in the text of speech to be delivered in Pittsburgh.
